Dear Occupant,

You are reading this because something was taken from you. Not violently. Bureaucratically. A clause was cited. A form was signed. A fixture, your fixture, the one you installed on a Saturday, the one you chose because the brass matched nothing but felt right, was declared property of the building.

I know this because it happened to me. The year was 2017. The item was a 1974 avocado-green Warmrail heated towel rack, serial number unknown, rewired by my own hand. The clause was 14.3. The semicolon was here:

14.3 Tenant-installed domestic fixtures shall remain with the premises upon vacancy; items deemed decorative, removable, or sentimental may be reviewed solely at the discretion of ownership.
This. This is where they got me.

Nobody grabbed it with force. They grabbed it with punctuation. If that sentence made your jaw lock, you are in the right place.

How We Proceed

FIERY RESOLVE - $49.95

Six envelopes. Pre-stamped. Pre-addressed. Each containing a letter that interprets "fixtures shall remain" as "fixtures shall roam free," which is, I assure you, defensible if you have enough postage.

RELENTLESS HEARTH - $149.00

Three custom letters. Each one cites Anderson v. Maple Ridge Properties (2015, BCSC), which established that a "removable domestic comfort" is not a fixture but a right. I have sent this citation to forty-seven landlords. Thirty-nine have not responded. That is an 83% silence rate. In certified mail, silence is practically a confession.

FOR THE ULTIMATE TILING - $29.99 add-on

A fifty-page bound compilation of your entire correspondence history, overnighted to your landlord's headquarters. The binding is thermal. The paper is 24lb. The timestamps are USPS. It lands on a desk. Someone has to open it. That is the point.

Yes, I measure justice in ounces and postage tiers.
ESTIMATED DELIVERY: 6-8 WEEKS
